Trial_Design.evidence: Patients with newly diagnosed breast cancer were randomized to either preoperative MRI or conventional imaging.

Participants.evidence: Patients with newly diagnosed breast cancer were randomized to either preoperative MRI or conventional imaging.

Intervention.evidence: Patients with newly diagnosed breast cancer were randomized to either preoperative MRI or conventional imaging.

Method_Outcome.evidence: evaluating MRI and its effect on disease-free survival (DFS) and overall survival (OS).

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 440 patients, aged 56 years or less, with newly diagnosed breast cancer were randomized to either preoperative MRI (220) or conventional imaging (220; control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: DFS rates were 85.5 and 80.0 per cent for the MRI and control groups respectively ( P = 0.099). The risk of relapse or death was 46 per cent higher in the control group (HR 1.46, 95 per cent c.i. 0.93 to 2.29).
